isis.stitle: CF 500, CF 600 - Electrical - Instrument Cluster - Diagnosis and Testing

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Wiring Diagrams, Instrument Cluster for schematic and connector information.

svcsubproc.title: Principles of Operation
svcsubproc.para: The instrument cluster is a hybrid electronic cluster (HEC) that contains a microprocessor, gauges, indicator lamps and internal circuitry. The instrument cluster is non-repairable.

The instrument cluster carries out a display prove-out to verify that the warning/indicator lamps and monitored systems are operating correctly. When the ignition switch is turned to the ON position with the engine off, the following indicators illuminate for 3 seconds:

item.para: Wait to Start (this indicator may stay on longer if the ECM determines that glow plugs will be required to start the engine)

svcsubproc.para: This Liquid Crystal Display (LCD) module provides the odometer and trip odometer information.

The instrument cluster receives a vehicle speed signal from the engine control module (ECM) through the communication network. The instrument cluster monitors this input from the ECM and commands a corresponding movement of the speedometer pointer.

The tachometer is electrically operated and indicates the engine speed in revolutions per minute (rpm). The tachometer range is 0 to 4,000 rpm. The tachometer receives the signal through the communication network from the ECM. If the rpm information sent to the instrument cluster is invalid or missing, the instrument cluster defaults the tachometer to 0 rpm.

The odometer is tamper-resistant and accumulates and registers up to one million kilometers in metric mode or one million miles in English mode, based upon rolling count data sent from the ECM over the communication network. The trip odometer is resettable and accumulates and registers up to 999.9 kilometers (999.9 miles).

The instrument cluster is hardwired to the fuel sending unit, which is a variable resistor controlled by the action of a float arm. When the fuel level is low, resistance in the unit is low. When the fuel level is high, the resistance is high. The instrument cluster uses the input from the fuel sender and commands the fuel gauge indication according to the fuel level data. The fuel gauge has an integrated low fuel warning indicator.

The instrument cluster monitors the engine coolant temperature data received from the ECM over the communication network, and commands the temperature gauge indication with a corresponding movement of the pointer. The engine coolant temperature gauge has an integrated temperature warning indicator.

The ABS warning indicator is used to indicate an ABS concern or deactivation of the ABS. The instrument cluster, upon receipt of the ABS message from the ABS module through the communication network, turns on the ABS warning indicator.

The instrument cluster brake fluid level warning indicator illuminates when there is a low brake fluid level. The brake fluid level switch is hardwired to the instrument cluster. The brake fluid level switch provides a ground to the instrument cluster when the brake fluid level is low or when the electrical connector is disconnected.

The instrument cluster park brake warning indicator illuminates when the parking brake is applied. The parking brake switch is hardwired to the instrument cluster. The parking brake switch provides a ground to the instrument cluster when the parking brake switch is applied.

Internal circuitry in the voltage regulator provides a ground path to the instrument cluster and the indicator illuminates. When the generator builds up enough voltage to energize the voltage regulator, voltage is applied to the ground side of the indicator effectively removing the ground path and turning the indicator off.

The safety belt warning indicator is powered through the instrument cluster and is grounded through the safety belt switch. When the safety belt is buckled, the switch opens and the instrument cluster turns off the safety belt warning indicator. When the safety belt is unbuckled, the switch closes and provides a ground to the instrument cluster to illuminate the safety belt warning indicator.

The instrument cluster receives data from the transmission control module (TCM) over the communication network. The TCM communicates to the instrument cluster to illuminate the transmission warning indicator if a DTC is set by the TCM.

The instrument cluster receives data from the TCM over the communication network. The TCM communicates to the instrument cluster to illuminate the transmission warning indicator if the transmission oil is above the calibrated temperature.

The instrument cluster receives data from the ECM over the communication network. The ECM communicates to the instrument cluster to illuminate the water-in-fuel indicator when the fuel system water collector is full.

The instrument cluster receives data from the ECM over the communication network. The ECM communicates to the instrument cluster to illuminate the change oil indicator when the ECM determines an oil change is necessary.

The instrument cluster will illuminate the indicator continuously when there is a loss of communication between the instrument cluster and the ECM, TCM or ABS module. The indicator will flash if the instrument cluster determines that the ABS indicator is not functional.
The fuel gauge has an integrated low fuel warning indicator. This indicator will illuminate when the fuel level is below 1/8 of the tank.

The instrument cluster will illuminate the indicator continuously when the engine coolant temperature is above 110°C (230°F). The indicator will flash if the instrument cluster does not receive coolant temperature information from the ECM.

The instrument cluster provides a ground for the high beam indicator. When the high beam headlamps are turned ON, the multifunction switch provides a power signal to the instrument cluster through hardwired circuitry and illuminates the high beam indicator.

The instrument cluster provides a ground for the RH and LH turn indicators. When the multifunction switch is in the RH or LH turn position, power is supplied to the instrument cluster through hardwired circuitry and the RH or LH turn indicators flash ON and OFF. The indicators will operate when the hazard switch is ON, regardless of the key position.

The wait to start signal is transmitted to the instrument cluster over the communication network from the ECM. The wait to start indicator illuminates when the ignition switch is in the ON position with the engine OFF indicating that the glow plugs are heating.

The tow/haul indicator illuminates when the tow/haul button is pressed on the transmission range (TR) selector lever. When the vehicle is in the tow mode, the indicator is illuminated by a signal from the ECM to inform the operator that the vehicle will not shift into overdrive. When the indicator is illuminated, the vehicle also provides engine braking and early transmission downshifts when braking on downhill grades.
The PTO indicator illuminates when a signal from the TCM tells the instrument cluster that the PTO unit is in use.

step1.para: Visually inspect for obvious signs of mechanical and electrical damage.
If the fault is not visually evident, determine the symptom and GO to the Symptom Chart.

entry.para: The speedometer, tachometer or temperature gauge is inoperative.
The park brake warning indicator is never on
The park brake warning indicator is always on
The brake fluid level warning indicator is never on
The brake fluid level warning indicator is always on
The charging system indicator is never on
The charging system indicator is always on
The high beam indicator is never on
The LH or RH turn indicator is never on
The low fuel or coolant temperature warning indicator is inoperative/always on

item.para: If the fuel or coolant temperature gauge operates correctly, INSTALL a new instrument cluster. For additional information, refer to Instrument Cluster Removal and Installation in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.

entry.para: The ABS, transmission warning, transmission temp warning, tow/haul, PTO, wait-to-start, water-in-fuel, stop engine warning, engine warning, or change oil indicator is inoperative/always on.

item.para: INSTALL a new instrument cluster. Refer to Instrument Cluster Removal and Installation in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.

svcsubproc.title: Pinpoint Tests

para.emph: Pinpoint Test A: Incorrect Fuel Gauge Indication

svcsubproc.para: Under normal operation, the fuel level sender is grounded through circuit 57 (BK). The instrument cluster reads a variable voltage from the fuel level sender through circuit 29 (YE/WH).

item.para: A short to ground in circuit 29 (YE/WH)

table.title: PINPOINT TEST A: INCORRECT FUEL GAUGE INDICATION

item.para: Measure the resistance between ground and instrument cluster C220a-10, circuit 29 (YE/WH).

entry.para: Compare the resistance to the levels below.
Tank Level: Above Full - Sensor Resistance: 157-163 Ohms
Tank Level: Full - Sensor Resistance: 142-148 Ohms
Tank Level: Empty - Sensor Resistance: 24-26 Ohms
Tank Level: Below Empty - Sensor Resistance: 14-16 Ohms

para.emph: Does the measured resistance match the resistance above?

entry.para: INSTALL a new instrument cluster. REFER to Instrument Cluster, Removal and Installation in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
If the resistance is greater than 160 ohms, GO to A2.
If the resistance is less than 15 ohms, GO to A4.
If the resistance is 15-160 ohms, INSTALL a new fuel level sender. For additional information, refer to Fuel Tank and Lines in S15002. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A2 CHECK CIRCUIT 57 (BK) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between ground and fuel level sender C3262-A or C3261-4, circuit 57 (BK).

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR circuit 57 (BK) for an open. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A3 CHECK CIRCUIT 29 (YE/WH) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between fuel level sender C3262-B or C3261-2, circuit 29 (YE/WH) and instrument cluster C220a-10, circuit 29 (YE/WH).

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new fuel level sender. For additional information, refer to Fuel Tank and Lines in S15002. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR circuit 29 (YE/WH) for an open. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A4 CHECK CIRCUIT 29 (YE/WH) FOR A SHORT TO GROUND

item.para: Measure the resistance between ground and instrument cluster C220a-10, circuit 29 (YE/WH).

para.emph: Is the resistance greater than 10,000 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new fuel level sender. For additional information, refer to Fuel Tank and Lines in S15002. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR circuit 29 (YE/WH) for a short to ground. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test B: The Speedometer, Tachometer Or Temperature Gauge Is Inoperative

svcsubproc.para: Under normal operation, the instrument cluster receives voltage through circuit 489 (PK/BK). The instrument cluster is grounded through circuit 57 (BK).

table.title: PINPOINT TEST B: THE SPEEDOMETER, TACHOMETER OR TEMPERATURE GAUGE IS INOPERATIVE

item.para: Observe speedometer, tachometer or temperature gauge operation.

para.emph: B2 CHECK VOLTAGE TO THE INSTRUMENT CLUSTER

item.para: Measure the voltage between ground and instrument cluster C220a-1, circuit 489 (PK/BK).

para.emph: Is the voltage greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: REPAIR circuit 489 (PK/BK) for an open. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: B3 CHECK GROUND TO THE INSTRUMENT CLUSTER

item.para: Measure the resistance between ground and instrument cluster:

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new instrument cluster. Refer to Instrument Cluster, Removal and Installation in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR circuit 57 (BK) for an open. TEST the system for normal operation.

item.para: Enter the following diagnostic mode on the diagnostic tool: Vehicle Speed, Engine Speed or Coolant Temperature ECM PID.

para.emph: Did the vehicle speed, engine speed or coolant temperature change?

entry.para: INSTALL a new instrument cluster. Refer to Instrument Cluster, Removal and Installation in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
REFER to the engine manual EGES-305.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test C: The Park Brake Warning Indicator Is Never On

svcsubproc.para: Under normal operation, the park brake switch is grounded through circuit 57 (BK). When the park brake is applied, the park brake switch is closed and ground is provided to the instrument cluster park brake warning indicator through circuit 162 (LG/RD).

table.title: PINPOINT TEST C: THE PARK BRAKE WARNING INDICATOR IS NEVER ON

para.emph: C1 CHECK THE PARKING BRAKE SWITCH GROUND

item.para: Measure the resistance between ground and parking brake switch C306-A, circuit 57 (BK).

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR circuit 57 (BK) for an open. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C2 CHECK THE PARKING BRAKE SWITCH

entry.para: Connect a fused jumper wire between ground and parking brake switch C306-B, circuit 162 (LG/RD).

para.emph: Does the brake warning indicator illuminate?

entry.para: INSTALL a new parking brake switch. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C3 CHECK CIRCUIT 162 (LG/RD) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between instrument cluster C220a-12, circuit 162 (LG/RD) and parking brake switch C306-B, circuit 162 (LG/RD).

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new instrument cluster. Refer to Instrument Cluster, Removal and Installation in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR circuit 162 (LG/RD) for an open. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test D: The Park Brake Warning Indicator Is Always On

svcsubproc.para: Under normal operation, the park brake switch is grounded through circuit 57 (BK). When the park brake is applied, the park brake switch is closed and ground is provided to the instrument cluster park brake warning indicator through circuit 162 (LG/RD).

item.para: A short to ground in circuit 162 (LG/RD)

table.title: PINPOINT TEST D: THE PARK BRAKE WARNING INDICATOR IS ALWAYS ON

para.emph: D1 CHECK THE PARKING BRAKE SWITCH
Is the brake warning indicator OFF?

entry.para: INSTALL a new parking brake switch. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: D2 CHECK CIRCUIT 162 (LG/RD) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between ground and parking brake switch C306-B, circuit 162 (LG/RD).

para.emph: Is the resistance greater than 10,000 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new instrument cluster. For additional information, refer to Instrument Cluster, Removal and Installation in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR circuit 162 (LG/RD) for a short to ground. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test E: The Brake Fluid Level Warning Indicator Is Never On

svcsubproc.para: Under normal operation, the brake fluid level switch is grounded through circuit 57 (BK). When the fluid level is low, the brake fluid level switch is closed and ground is provided to the instrument cluster brake fluid level warning indicator through circuit 128 (VT/YE).

table.title: PINPOINT TEST E: THE BRAKE FLUID LEVEL WARNING INDICATOR IS NEVER ON

para.emph: E1 CHECK THE BRAKE FLUID LEVEL SWITCH GROUND

item.para: Disconnect: Brake Fluid Level Switch C124
Measure the resistance between ground and brake fluid level switch C124-B, circuit 57 (BK).

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR circuit 57 (BK) for an open. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: E2 CHECK THE BRAKE FLUID LEVEL SWITCH

item.para: Connect a fused jumper wire between ground and brake fluid level switch C124-A, circuit 128 (VT/YE).

para.emph: Does the brake fluid level warning indicator illuminate?

entry.para: INSTALL a new brake fluid level switch. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: E3 CHECK CIRCUIT 128 (VT/YE) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between instrument cluster C220b-12, circuit 128 (VT/YE) and brake fluid level switch C124-A, circuit 128 (VT/YE).

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new instrument cluster. For additional information, refer to Instrument Cluster, Removal and Installation in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR circuit 128 (VT/YE) for an open. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test F: The Brake Fluid Level Warning Indicator Is Always On

svcsubproc.para: Under normal operation, the brake fluid level switch is grounded through circuit 57 (BK). When the fluid level is low, the brake fluid level switch is closed and ground is provided to the instrument cluster brake fluid level warning indicator through circuit 128 (VT/YE).

item.para: A short to ground in circuit 128 (VT/YE)

table.title: PINPOINT TEST F: THE BRAKE FLUID LEVEL WARNING INDICATOR IS ALWAYS ON

para.emph: F1 CHECK THE BRAKE FLUID LEVEL SWITCH

item.para: Disconnect: Brake Fluid Level Switch C124
Observe the brake fluid level warning indicator.

para.emph: Is the brake fluid level warning indicator OFF?

entry.para: INSTALL a new brake fluid level switch. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: F2 CHECK CIRCUIT 128 (VT/YE) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between ground and brake fluid level switch C124-1, circuit 128 (VT/YE).

para.emph: Is the resistance greater than 10,000 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new instrument cluster. For additional information, refer to Instrument Cluster, Removal and Installation in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR circuit 128 (VT/YE) for a short to ground. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test G: The Charging System Indicator Is Never On

svcsubproc.para: Under normal operation, when voltage is low, the alternator control provides ground to the instrument cluster charging indicator through circuit 1818 (WH/BK)/904 (LG/RD).

table.title: PINPOINT TEST G: THE CHARGING SYSTEM INDICATOR IS NEVER ON

para.emph: G1 CHECK THE CHARGING SYSTEM WARNING INDICATOR OPERATION

item.para: Connect a fused jumper wire between ground and alternator control C102a-1, circuit 1818 (WH/BK).

para.emph: Does the charging system warning indicator illuminate?

entry.para: INSTALL a new alternator control. REFER to Generator and Regulator. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: G2 CHECK CIRCUIT 904 (LG/RD)/1818 (WH/BK) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between instrument cluster C220a-6, circuit 904 (LG/RD) and alternator control C102a-1, circuit 1818 (WH/BK).

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new instrument cluster. For additional information, refer to Instrument Cluster, Removal and Installation in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR circuit 904 (LG/RD)/1818 (WH/BK) for an open. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test H: The Charging System Indicator Is Always On

svcsubproc.para: Under normal operation, when voltage is low, the alternator control provides ground to the instrument cluster charging indicator through circuit 1818 (WH/BK)/904 (LG/RD).

item.para: A short to ground in circuit 1818 (WH/BK)/904 (LG/RD)

table.title: PINPOINT TEST H: THE CHARGING SYSTEM INDICATOR IS ALWAYS ON

para.emph: H1 CHECK THE CHARGING SYSTEM WARNING INDICATOR OPERATION

item.para: Observe the charging system warning indicator.

para.emph: Does the charging system warning indicator continue to illuminate?

entry.para: INSTALL a new alternator control. REFER to Generator and Regulator. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: H2 CHECK CIRCUIT 904 (LG/RD)/1818 (WH/BK) FOR A SHORT TO GROUND

item.para: Measure the resistance between ground and alternator control C102a-1, circuit 1818 (WH/BK).

para.emph: Is the resistance greater than 10,000 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new instrument cluster. For additional information, refer to Instrument Cluster, Removal and Installation in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR circuit 904 (LG/RD)/1818 (WH/BK) for a short to ground. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test I: The High Beam Indicator Is Never On

svcsubproc.para: Under normal operation, when the high beams are on, voltage is provided to the instrument cluster high beam indicator through circuit 1718 (RD/PK).

table.title: PINPOINT TEST I: THE HIGH BEAM INDICATOR IS NEVER ON

para.emph: I1 CHECK HIGH BEAM VOLTAGE TO THE INSTRUMENT CLUSTER

item.para: Place the multifunction switch in the HEADLAMPS position.
Measure the voltage between ground and instrument cluster C220a-11, circuit 1718 (RD/PK).

para.emph: Is the voltage greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: INSTALL a new instrument cluster. For additional information, refer to Instrument Cluster, Removal and Installation in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR circuit 1718 (RD/PK) for an open. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test J: The LH Or RH Turn Indicator Is Never On

svcsubproc.para: Under normal operation, when the LH or RH turn signals are on, voltage is provided to the instrument cluster LH or RH turn indicator through circuit (LH) 1719 (GY/BK) or (RH) 1720 (DB/OG).

table.title: PINPOINT TEST J: THE LH OR RH TURN INDICATOR IS NEVER ON

para.emph: J1 CHECK LH OR RH TURN SIGNAL VOLTAGE TO THE INSTRUMENT CLUSTER

item.para: Measure the voltage between ground and instrument cluster:

para.emph: Is the voltage pulse from 0 volts to greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: INSTALL a new instrument cluster. For additional information, refer to Instrument Cluster, Removal and Installation in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR circuit 1719 (GY/BK) or 1720 (DB/OG) for an open. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test K: The Instrument Cluster Is Inoperative

svcsubproc.para: Under normal operation, the instrument cluster receives voltage through circuit 489 (PK/BK). The instrument cluster is grounded through circuit 57 (BK).

table.title: PINPOINT TEST K: THE INSTRUMENT CLUSTER IS INOPERATIVE

para.emph: K1 CHECK VOLTAGE TO THE INSTRUMENT CLUSTER

item.para: Measure the voltage between ground and instrument cluster C220a-1, circuit 489 (PK/BK).

para.emph: Is the voltage greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: REPAIR circuit 489 (PK/BK) for an open. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: K2 CHECK GROUND TO THE INSTRUMENT CLUSTER

item.para: Measure the resistance between ground and instrument cluster:

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new instrument cluster. For additional information, refer to Instrument Cluster, Removal and Installation in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR circuit 57 (BK) for an open. TEST the system for normal operation.
